com.cloudera.oryx.rdf.common.eval

Class Evaluation

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.cloudera.oryx.rdf.common.eval.Evaluation

  • public final class Evaluation
extends Object
    A utility class containing methods related to evaluating a decision forest classifier.
    Author:
    Sean Owen

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Concrete Methods

      static double correctlyClassifiedFraction(TreeBasedClassifier classifier, Iterable<Example> testSet)

    • Method Detail

      • rootMeanSquaredError

        public static double rootMeanSquaredError(TreeBasedClassifier classifier,
                                          Iterable<Example> testSet)
        Parameters:
        classifier - a TreeBasedClassifier (e.g. DecisionForest) trained on data with a numeric target
        testSet - test set to evaluate on
        Returns:
        root mean squared error over the test set square root of mean squared difference between actual and predicted numeric target value

      • correctlyClassifiedFraction

        public static double correctlyClassifiedFraction(TreeBasedClassifier classifier,
                                                 Iterable<Example> testSet)
        Parameters:
        classifier - a TreeBasedClassifier (e.g. DecisionForest) trained on data with a numeric target
        testSet - test set to evaluate on
        Returns:
        fraction of test examples whose categorical target value was correctly predicted by the classifier

      • evaluateToWeight

        public static double[] evaluateToWeight(TreeBasedClassifier classifier,
                                        ExampleSet testSet)
        Parameters:
        classifier - a TreeBasedClassifier (e.g. DecisionForest) whose weights are to be determined from performance on a test set
        testSet - test set to evaluate on
        Returns:
        a double[] containing two values. The first is a weight for the classifier; the meaning depends on the type of target variable, but will be higher when the classifier is more accurate. The second is a raw evaluation score, which again varies by type of target feature: RMSE for numeric targets, correctly classified fraction for categorical.
